story:
Let me transform this resume into a coherent story:

Meet a dedicated Mechanical Designer whose journey in the manufacturing and design world spans over three decades. Their story begins in 1987, where they cut their teeth in the industry as a Parts Sales and Commercial Sales Account Manager, learning the fundamentals of business operations and inventory management.

Seeking to expand their horizons, they transitioned into hands-on manufacturing roles in the late 1990s, starting as a Polisher where they meticulously deburred parts, then advancing to a Shear Operator cutting precise sheet metal blanks. Their career took a significant turn when they became a Laser Operator, mastering the Trumpf Trumatic systems and earning specialized certifications in laser operations.

The early 2000s marked their evolution into programming and administrative work, where they spent a decade as an NC Programmer and Administrative Assistant. This role combined their technical skills with business acumen, handling everything from CNC programming to price quotes and work order management.

Driven by a desire for professional growth, they pursued higher education while working, earning an Associates of Applied Science Degree in Computer Aided Drafting & Design from ITT Technical Institute in 2011, maintaining an impressive 3.88 GPA.

This educational achievement led to their role as a Mechanical Designer from 2011 to 2017, where they specialized in designing Ammonia Processing Control Units using Autodesk Inventor. Their expertise in 3D modeling, combined with strong problem-solving abilities, made them an invaluable asset both in design and on the shop floor.

Throughout their career, they've maintained a commitment to continuous learning, acquiring certifications in SolidWorks, Productivity Enhancement, and various CAD systems. Their journey showcases a unique blend of hands-on manufacturing experience, technical design expertise, and project management skills, all underpinned by strong communication abilities and a dedication to improvement.

This professional stands out for their rare combination of practical experience and technical knowledge, making them particularly effective at bridging the gap between design concepts and real-world manufacturing challenges. Their story is one of continuous growth, adaptability, and technical excellence in the mechanical design field.
